title: A nice little knife, but dont expect a lot.
body: Well hopefully if youre interested in buying this knife you dont think it will be one of the best out there, because its not.  I mean the fact thats its Stainless steel and really low priced should have given that away.  BUT, if that doesnt bother you and you just want a very basic, thin knife, I recommend this one.For a CQC knife, its perfect for concealed carry (please make sure its legal in your state to do so, im not liable if you get arrested) due to its very thin design.  The handle is wrapped with only paracord, so theres no wooden or plastic handle to make things bulky.  You could slip it inside your waistband and no one would suspect a thing.  I also like the black finish and green cord color combination, but that just my opinion though I imagine a popular one :).The paracord is not very good quality.  It works as a handle wrapping, but if you want a stronger cord or something that looks nicer, go buy it separately.  I probably wont replace it because it just wont be worth the extra money to me.  The cord is also really long.  It extends well past the handle, but you can make it shorter by tying knots into it.  The wrapping is fairly good, but a little too loose.  It looks like they could have fit another section or two since im able to slide it around a bit.  If you dont mind re-wrapping it, it shouldnt be a problem for you.I wish that the knife came much sharper than it did.  Really, this thing cant even cut paper.  You know how some sword or knife owners hold a piece of paper in front of them and then just slice diagonally across the paper?  Yeah, I tried that with this knife and it didnt work.  Just crumpled up the paper.  The good news is, blades can be sharpened and so can this one.  However, arriving to me dull certainly isnt going to earn it more stars.  At least the point is still...pointy.I dont know how good the durability and edge retention is and I dont feel like destruction testing it.  Its 440 stainless steel, so I cant imagine this knife would be any different in that regard from any other knife of its size thats also 440 stainless.  Im a sword guy, so I dont know much about stainless steel knives and how they are tempered or whatever...if at all.  Ive heard 440, while isnt the best stainless steel, isnt the worst so that should give you an idea on its durability and edge retention.  Again, I dont know how it was heat treated or tempered.  The black finish would probably start to scratch and come off with use, unfortunately.The magnesium striker works pretty well.  You kind of have to both hit and slide the blade on the striker to get it to spark.  Youll figure it out.  I was looking at it and I saw little dots in my vision for a couple seconds.  I havent tested it for making a fire yet, but ill come back with those details later.As for the nylon sheath?  It does have a belt strap.  At first I didnt notice it, but I eventually found a loop to slide my belt through.  The tip can actually easily poke right through it.  I may just try to reinforce the bottom somehow to prevent the tip from poking through.  Other than that, it works well.  Theres a little pocket to fit the fire starter too.Blade:  3'Finger Groove:  1 1/2'Handle:  2 1/2'Total Grip Length:  4'Thickness:  3/16'Overall, why would I rate this knife at only 4 stars and enjoy it so much despite all the cons?  I dont know, maybe its the shape and size.  I mean I didnt expect much from the start.  Now if I payed much more for this knife, id be pretty disappointed.  But I didnt.  I wish that the blade was about an inch longer, but whatever.  So on that note, I recommend this knife.  Admittedly, I got interested in these types of knives after playing Metal Gear Solid 3.  Since I dont want to spend so much money on a Strider model HT or DB, this will have to do.  Actually, I think this knife is almost exactly the same in terms of shape toa Strider DB.  Interesting.  The CQC knife that Snake uses in Metal Gear Solid 3 is much closer to the Strider HT.By the way, the box it came in is extremely simple.  All white, a picture of the knife and striker, and 'HUNTING KNIFE' in bold letters written on every side.  Inside, all it comes with is the knife, sheath, and stiker.  Thats it.  No bubble wrap or piece of paper.  I know its just the box, but I thought you should know.a Strider DB.  Interesting.  The CQC knife that Snake uses in Metal Gear Solid 3 is much closer to the Strider HT.By the way, the box it came in is extremely simple.  All white, a picture of the knife and striker, and 'HUNTING KNIFE' in bold letters written on every side.  Inside, all it comes with is the knife, sheath, and stiker.  Thats it.  No bubble wrap or piece of paper.  I know its just the box, but I thought you should know.

title: Quality Knife
body: Absolutely a cool product the pricing on the knife was awesome. I couldnt touch the magnesium striker for the price I paid for the complete package

title: Five Stars
body: cool

title: This is a very nice knife. It is light weight and sharp
body: This is a very nice knife.  It is light weight and sharp.  It also has a cool appearance.  I've purchased 3 of them, and they will make nice gifts to friends.

title: OK to play with
body: I bought this to play with in the garage ( changed the profile, removed the black paint, etc, etc) since its cheaper than finding a blank anywhere. Keeps an OK edge. However if you want a real knife with a real sheath for a few dollars more you should just buy a Morakniv companion.

title: Four Stars
body: Good product . Good price

title: Five Stars
body: I absolutely love it!

title: Five Stars
body: Great

title: you get what you pay for
body: Not a great knife or a great fire starter, but they both work in a pinch. The "para cord" on the handle of the knife is crap, get rid of it and wrap it in some real paracord, or leather or duct tape, whatever you want. The knife itself is OK, in that it is a full tang  so no cheap plastic handle, but I'm not sure of the quality of the metal. It can be sharpened to a decent edge, but I'm not sure how well it will hold it. The fire starter works, but mine does not stay in it's little handle, I need to put a dab of super glue to hold it in there. The sheath is also crap.All that said, it's only 7 bucks, and really it's worth it for that.

title: Five Stars
body: great for digging and prying!

title: Ok, can we cut the hotshot crap...
body: What you are getting for under $7 is an amazing deal. Is it a SK-5? No. Is it a KA-Bar? No. I do not DVR any popular survival shows, but I sure as hell take this knife out often for training and find it very useful for a variety of tasks. Am I dumb enough to only take this knife with me and bet my life on it? Hell no!!!! Use common sense and this knife will serve you well.

title: Good
body: Wonderful  August 21, 2012 By C. Marcum "Carmen"POWERFUL, BRIGHT, RUGGED, LOVE IT I LOVE IT SO MUCH I BOUGHT 2 MORE FOR MY FELLOW BOUNCERS, I TESTED ...

title: Four Stars
body: The knife isn't amazing but it works decently, the firestarter just drowns things in sparks, overall good product.

title: Small Handle
body: The knife is OK but the handle is really to small for an adult's hand.  It might be good for a kid or ...

title: Nice Field Paring knife
body: While it has a smaller length than expected, it is like a field paring knife. It is just right for skinning small game up to about rabbit size. Could be use for a throwing knife. Corded handle wants to untie, but a little heat will bond the turns together.

title: Four Stars
body: It's not a bad tool to have in the truck or go bag.

title: ... product has been real helpful and is lightweight and easy to carry and sharpen
body: this product has been real helpful and is lightweight and easy to carry and sharpen; start fires and carve with as well.

title: Five Stars
body: Really nice

title: Survivla Knife
body: Buy more than one. Good bug out bag knife to keep in every bag for the price.

title: Two Stars
body: It was very dull upon arrival

title: Firestarter sparks like a champ
body: Firestarter sparks like a champ.Knife is full tang, comes incredibly dull - but that's what the reviewers said - after some tender loving sharpening the blade is now useful, was cheap, and is a thick knife so it'll be around for awhile.

title: Great Knife
body: Great knife at a good price.  Will probably get some more.

title: RIPPED OFF NO DELIVERY
body: Ordered this knife Dec 1st. Its now Dec 17th and no knife. Big Rippoff. Dontbuy from this jerk no matter how cheap the knifes go for. Notice price keeps changing also. They lure people in, then start fiddling with the prices once they make a few cheap sells.

title: Just what I was looking for.
body: I was looking for a fire steel and thought this item had an added bonus because it came with a knife.  The knife is 'knarley' looking and don't take up much room in my pack.  It will work well as the rough 'workhorse' around camp, but i wouldn't try and use it for any delicate cutting.  Handy, light-weight, priced right, just what I was looking for!

title: pretty solid, but small
body: Apparently they mean 7 inch total length, which I could have guessed but wasn't really paying attention.the fire starter sparks really well. My blade wasn't really sharp, and doesn't hold a very good edge. The sheath is kinda a joke, but its useable if you aren't too hard on it.Anyway, I dont regret buying this and would recommend it.

title: Four Stars
body: Very reliable with camping and what not.

title: Very much worth the money
body: This knife has everything you need. Paired with an EZ Sharpener this knife is a perfect cheap solution to finding a great EDC knife.

title: I'm doubtful about the quality of this knife but the ...
body: I'm doubtful about the quality of this knife but the person I gave it to as a Christmas gift was thrilled.

title: simple and nice
body: simple and nice, used it a little as a throwing knife and worked just fine (unlike me ), the ignition bar is a nice touch. the size and specification are accurate, but when you actually hold it you will find it too small. Anyway it has its uses. I will use it as a diving knife in my next dive, it's expected to get a little rusty, but nothing can't be cleaned.

title: AWESOME!
body: I bought this knife because it was cheap and so far it looks nice.  Light weight and comes with a free flint stick

title: You get what you pay for.
body: Ok I had to resharpen it and I put new actual 550 paracord then it is a alright knife although the sheath is cheap and it's very low quality steel I have a knife that's made of normal quality steel and it sparks perfectly with the fire starter.

title: Survivor knives
body: Can never have enough knives. Got this for the kids bug out bags and I am happy with the purchase. We'll see how it handles in the field soon.

title: Five Stars
body: Pefect gift

title: OK
body: The blade isn't sharp, and the handle is pretty uncomfortable but for the price, it's good to have.  We keep it in our camping gear as a "just in case" and really don't expect to do anything crazy with it like skin a deer or filet a fish.  Works as a basic tool, if you need it.

title: Small for a survival knife but cheap so why not...
body: Not sure what I expected, really. Price was right. I got what I paid for. Doesn't seem terribly sharp and it is certainly rather small for a survival knife. The fire starter sparks which is about all I could ask of it. It is a bit small also. But these things could probably save your bacon should you ever get into a situation so worth the money to buy one and stash it somewhere it will probably (you hope) never get used.

title: Not bad for the price.
body: This knife was sturdier than I expected for the price. It's a nice lightweight backup for general purpose use. The fire starter is easily lost if not secured though.

title: It's not bad though just need to take it easy on it
body: I bought this so that I could have a knife and fire starter just in case. the knife is well made, the fire starter works however the flint keeps popping out. It's not bad though just need to take it easy on it. I think that it would be easy to replace the flint so all in all a good buy.

title: Knife
body: This knife is ok. Its a little small but seems to be of decent quality. Its  good backup knife. and a neat little fire starter kit.

title: Great cheap, utility knife (pokes through holder)
body: This knife did not come very sharp and it is a little difficult to sharpen due to its shape. It is a great, durable utility knife. I've used it for prying, taking out screws in a pinch, and lighting fires using the fire starter--things you wouldn't do with a really expensive knife. I still use the (nylon/plastic?) knife holder but the point of the knife does poke through a little bit. Be careful!

title: Only con is crappy lanyard cordage.
body: Love this blade. I re-wrapped the handle with real 550 cord and had to really give the edge some TLC. Have not tested it yet to see if it keeps the edge but over all very impressed with the knife for the price.

title: Heck yeah!
body: a must have for the price! yes the blade is dull, yes the sheath sucks, and yes its not real 550 cordthat being said this knife is sweet! comes with a fire starter that works well. I re wrapped the handle with actual 550 cord and sharpened the blade using my Smith's pocket sharpener and bam I know how a perfect survival knife.you will have to do a little work with this blade to make it a viable tool but I think its great! I would recommend this item and I will be buying a couple more

title: Replaced it with paracetamol and sharpened blade for a pretty rugged shtf tool
body: Yeah as other reviews say, original rope is cheap and uncomfortable.  Replaced it with paracetamol  and sharpened blade for a pretty rugged shtf tool.

title: Five Stars
body: No problems to be seen

title: Five Stars
body: perfect!!! So much better than another one I ordered form another sender!!

title: Very nice blade.
body: The item shipped exactly as described, and a week early! With standard shipping, the item arrived within four days. The blade is sharp, and well etched. A good knife for the price.

title: The best compact knife
body: Is very ressistan and condortable i kill so many ducks with it is a piece of gold sharp it after you use

title: For The Money - 5 stars.
body: Came quickly and undamaged.Everybody is giving critiques as though this is a $100 knife. It costs less than $10!Knife point is very sharp. Knife edges are ehh. Firestarter works just fine - lots of sparks created. Handle, ehh.So, for under $10 you get a great firestarter and a back-up knife. 5 stars.

title: Five Stars
body: You need to shape

title: Ready,.. Start,.. Fire!...
body: Really cool knife combo. Easy to use, feels pretty solid. Blade is dull but that's to be expected and is an easy fix. Besides even if it was 'Sharp' I'd probably would sharpen to my liking. The roping is no better than a rope lanyard that you would use on a company badge. Best way to describe it.The magnesium stick works great. Just remember to angle ur knife (Sharp side) to a 45 degree to get the best results. Another cool Xmas gift for the outdoors men  or to have for if the 'SHTF'- like Red Dawn  or zombie outbreak predicament. Hope this helps.

title: Its under 10 bucks what do you expect
body: Bought one to have a blade I don't care about damaging the edge and its perfect for that role.  The blade comes somewhat sharp however uneven sharpening makes reprofiling the blade a must.  I used some very coarse stones and achieved this fairly easily and then god a near razor sharp edge on it before I called it quits.  The fire starter is nice(wouldn't rely on it) but doesn't sit very secure in the sheath, and speaking of the sheath it's not bad but chances are if its on your belt or other exposed area on a hard haul the blade will fall out due to the cheap Velcro fastenings.

title: I like the blade, but the flint sucks and broke easily
body: this flint broke on the first try. I wasn't very happy about that. I do like the blade. only paid like 6-7 dollars, so not a big deal

title: Looks nice, but is poorly made.
body: The steel seems to be ok; however, its factory edge is terrible. It is not sharp when it has never been used, but the real issue is edge of the blade is not uniform. The edge goes from one side to the other down the length of the blade. In order to sharpen it well, about an eighth to a quarter of and inch of steel will need to be shaved off in order to provide a good edge. After all this work the knife may turn out to be descent, but the factory product is of poor quality.

title: The sheath is garbage, and the para-cord handle is junk
body: The sheath is garbage, and the para-cord handle is junk. The knife itself is okay, I guess...I don't plan on ever using it though.

title: Good value for money
body: Could be sharper but something that can easily be fixed. Very good looking and very nice liner sleve. Good value for money

title: Ok
body: the knife is good don't get me wrong. But the case is garbage and the fire steel is cheap. The handle broke off. Don't even use it

title: Five Stars
body: Cheap good then I lost it!!!!

title: Overall
body: Great bladed knife easily sharpened only problem the string wrap sucks. Rewrapped with paracord. I would recommend this knife as a backup in your hunting bag

title: Nice little knife but is cheaply made and the steel in the blade isn't much good for anything more than cutting warm butter
body: I had to sharpen this before I could use it but it a well made knife for the money. It is small and pocketable.

title: good deal
body: for the price this is a great deal.fire starter works though the plastic handle came out after starting a couple fires. overall for what you pay you can't go wrong. nice and cheap hunting/camping knife

title: does the job
body: There is nothing spectacular about this knife but for the price i think its a good purchase. It actually does make sparkles to make fire. So I do recommend it.

title: Five Stars
body: Love it

title: Five Stars
body: Have to get use to it but very useful.

title: Five Stars
body: awesome lightweight, sharp, with flint. Couldnt ask for more

title: Four Stars
body: Nice knife especially for the price.

title: Five Stars
body: Nice and compact, serves me well while hunting or other home /house activities.

title: thanx!!
body: Thanx but carrier note defaults to leave if no one responds !??? Not cool  but other wise thanx great I'm very satisfied

title: Four Stars
body: good Item for $$.

title: ok
body: its a good little knife but its not the survivor hk its a cheap ripoff that looks a lot like it

title: great fire starter crapy knife
body: the blade came some what sharp with a couple cuts to some card board and it was useless im going to put a new edge on it cuz this thing will not sharpen

title: It's worth a buy
body: This showed up on time i gotta say it was nice looking at it it has a great feel and i was super happy trying out the fire starterBut here my pros and consPros-Very soft black touch to it-comes with super sharp knife not dall at all-has a great feel in hands-Comes good walking around the woodsCons-You have to take while trying to spark the fire starter-the road can be pain in the ass sometimes-super legal to carry around town or with you-does not light a fire as wellI would suggest looking for another knife that has a fire starter

title: Pretty Nice Knife For The Price!
body: Perfect knife to throw in your bug out bag for an extra!

title: This is well worth the money. I have had and used this for years now and just happened to get an e-mail asking to review.
body: This knife is cool as s***. I bought this a couple years ago and I still use it on every outdoor adventure. I really like the para-cord wrapped handle. I think this should be in every camping kit or bug out bad. Its perfect because its solid, has a great grip and is cheap enough you can buy several so you don't have to keep switching it to different kits. The fire starter has came in handy a couple times and still has many uses left. Overall I am happy with this purchase.

title: Five Stars
body: It is great but yes the cord and sheath must be changed out.

title: Five Stars
body: great knife for the price

title: The bare essentials
body: I love this blade! Cheap but does with it's supposed to do for survival expeditions. I have not exposed it enough in the elements to see how long it takes for rust to build in so I can't say much on that yet. I usually keep it in my emergency bag in the car just in case. I would buy one for each car I own in the future. Thanks.

title: Five Stars
body: love it.

title: Misrepresented
body: I thought I was buying a black knife as depicted in the photo.  It showed up olive drab.  Additionally, I'd have better success cutting something with the attached paracord, than with the actual knife.  It took about 10 minutes to sharpen, and it's OK now.  The attached sheath is virtually useless... but it'll have to work until I can find another way to protect myself from the now semi-sharpened edge.  All in all... eh... $7 bucks...

title: ... for 10 year old son (first knife) and he loved it! Very nice
body: Bought this for 10 year old son (first knife) and he loved it! Very nice, rugged design. Good quality!

title: Best 3 bucks I've spent in a long time
body: I bought this knife as part of a $5.00 Weekly Survival Gear Challenge primarily for the fire starter.The fire starter is very easy to light but really should be attached far better than the standard way it comes.After reading the reviews, it sounded like this knife could be a great back up. Yes, the cord is less than desired and the blade is duller than an soup spoon but both of these are easy fixes. Now it's re-wrapped with 550 para cord and sharpened. It's a full tang  of good weight and size for my small hand.The sheath is horrible! and the flimsy Velcro strap doesn't stay latched but I knew what to expect beforehand and I got exactly what I expected.

title: It's a knife... meh.
body: Not good quality, even for the price (which i think was $10). Really dull, really bad steel, ok sheath, poor quality firestarter.

title: kick ass
body: this knife kicks ass. it is going on my assault vest. perfect for what it is, a groovy little survival knife.

title: Good knife
body: Overall a pretty good knife. The fire starter was popping out of it's holder though. But the knife was nice and the fire starter did work

title: It does require some sharpening to get a better edge, but it is a good quality steel
body: You can't beat this for the money.  It does require some sharpening to get a better edge, but it is a good quality steel.  The fire starter has an oxide coating on it, so be sure to break through that to get sparks.  Use the serrated back side of the blade on the fire starter so you don't dull your knife.

title: I love this thing
body: I love this thing. I bought these for last minute stocking stuffer and once they arrived I had to keep on for myself. It was easy to use. I have started 3 fires so far. Be warned tat the fire starter does not stay in the holder. Be sure to secure it by sliding the string of the fire starter around the handle of the knife before putting into its pouch then Velcro the knife in. This has worked very well to keep them together.

title: Four Stars
body: Good for my needs

title: You get what you pay for.
body: I bought this for doing light duty tasks in the landscaping field such as opening plastic bags and cutting landscape fabric. It barely does that. It arrived quite dull so I took the whetstone to it and gave it a razor edge so sharp that I ruined the nylon belt sheath it came with. I was positive the sharpening session had taken care of my issue with the dull blade. Unfortunately, after cutting about three yards of heavy duty landscape fabric, the blade went dull again. I surmised the metal must be crappy. If you really expect to be trapped in the woods and depend on this knife for survival, don't buy it. You will probably die. If you just want a menacing looking weapon that will frighten old ladies at the grocery store and make you look tough, buy two! The knife does look pretty cool. The price was really cheap so overall I'm not complaining too much but it is an inferior product.

title: Knives good...color not good
body: The knives are good and I love the sheaths that come with them but the color is definitely not true to the cranberry. I was disappointed that it didn't match my other pieces. I have cranberry and brown temptations and the handle of these knives fell in between there. I was not pleased but I didn't want to send them back.

title: Great knife!
body: Get this knife, they make it look small in the picture but this thing is pretty hefty. Also, I love the knife sharpener in came with, for the price, this is a great value.

title: So Cheap You Can't Go Wrong
body: For $6 shipping included this knife is more than adequate. It is not very sharp out of the box but it can be sharpened. It will cut paper with a bit of sawing action. It makes a really nice present for a kid. I have not tried the flint striker but it is neat that one is included at the low price. Recommend to buy for young kid that likes to camp. If they lose it it's not a big deal.

title: My Purchase
body: OK the product met my expectations, arrived in a timely manner and was consistent with the purchasing advertisement. Wrapped too tightly so cut the cord while opening - bummer! I was happy to obtain the product, payment was easy and AMAZON rocks!

title: good knife for price.
body: Good price, decent for a cheap knife. Fast shipping.

title: Good knife for the price.
body: Don't expect a sharp 100 dollar knife when ordering this product. Have reasonable expectations and you will be satisfied. My knife arrived very dull. I spent about ten minutes on a grinding wheel and it is now very sharp and holds it's edge reasonably well. The fire starter actually works quite well after you scrape the black coating off of it. I see a lot of reviews bashing this product because it is not a 80 dollar K-BAR. You spent five bucks, what did you expect. For the purpose of a beat around knife I keep in my truck and do not mind damaging using as a hammer or pry-bar when need be, it fits the bill. It is one piece of steel so it is relatively strong. I replaced my handle with real para-cord instead of the flimsy soft stuff that came on it. Would recommend it.

title: Hunting
body: Gave to my husband, he goes in the woods alot, and just felt like this would be very handy knife to have, he loved it!

title: very good little knife
body: extremely well made for under $10. this is good steel, sturdy and holds an edge. worth way more than $7.00! wish they made a 10"

title: Five Stars
body: nice blade for the cash

title: Love it!
body: This is a wonderful knife to have when walking, and I have used it many times with it's sharp blade, but have yet to use the fire stick on it. This is the second one I have purchased, as I gave the first one to my Grandson who uses his when they go camping. Love it!

title: Three Stars
body: Compact and could be a good knife. Hard to sharpen because of hardness of steel. Fire starter doesn't work

title: As advertized
body: As most reviews before this... sheath is what the priceline indicates, the cordage may come in hand for 'something' but the knife is stout, sturdy and so far dependable. sharpen it properly.

title: Five Stars
body: good sharp edge. good for the price

title: Great backup knife for my hunting bag.
body: I like this because it has several features to help if I have problems while outdoors.  Definitely worth the money.

title: Thank you
body: Thank you

title: Kinda Small
body: Small knife but I knew that when I ordered it. Good price, but I will stick to Gerber and give this to my 7 year old daughter

title: Awesome value survival knife!
body: People say don't skimp on survival equipment but this cheap knife can definitely get the job done! First off, yes the blade is made in China. Now, the blade is only about 3 inches and is very light and easy to wield. The tip is EXTREMELY sharp and will do damage to you, your clothes and even the sheath if you aren't paying attention. It is a great knife for small work cutting rope or preparing food etc. This is NOT AN AXE! I guess in a pinch it could be used okay as self defense. The paracord wrap is alright but is easily removable and can be done in your own way if you wish. The blade sharpens well and holds an edge pretty good for a cheap knife. The fire starter takes a second to work at first when you're removing the black coating on it. Once you get passed that it sparks flames and starts fires like a pro. Don't try this in your house. The sparks are extremely hot and will burn everything they touch. The sheath that came with the knife leaves more to be desired and is green. It is cheap looking and feeling. It has two pouches each for the stick and the knife itself and THERE IS A BELT LOOP. The entire thing, sheath and all, is super light and easy to conceal. Honestly, to not buy this knife if you're a camper, survivalist or whatever then that's a mistake that you're making. It's cheap ($6.19 at time of purchase) and does multiple jobs very well. You cannot go wrong.

title: Small Dull Knife for a cheap price
body: If it didn't come with a piece of flint, it wouldn't be worth the price, but it did, so it is. It's a low quality knife that comes SUPER DULL.If you're looking for a cheap mini backup knife for your Bug Out Bag, then this is actually for you.Keep in mind that you have to sharpen it though. I've done a bit of sharpening and mine is still pretty dull.This is one of those knives that you won't care about and use on things that would ruin a good knife.You could easily dedicate this as a flint striker that can sometimes be used as a 2nd rate knife, which is why I have one for my B.O.B. and eventually decided to get another one for my truck as a small, cheap, it's far better to have this than nothing, kind of knife.Unless if you're Rambo, this isn't even a decent weapon. I wouldn't want to get stabbed with it, but it's not something I would use to hunt an animal or defend myself with. But as a flint striker with some level of utility, it's ok.The wrist lanyard is some cheap cord, so if you replaced it with some length of 550 paracord, that'd be a decent place to have some.One one (not both) of this kind of knife that i ordered, the holster had the velcro's stitching go through both pieces of the belt loop part of the holster, so if you want to wear it on your belt, you may need to either sacrifice the velcro part that keeps the knife in place or restitch it. Or you could get one that's made correctly.

title: Five Stars
body: Exactly what I expected

title: Good Knife
body: This is a well built and sturdy blade and the price is great. I like this knife very much and will be buying another one soon.

title: Nice amateur knife!
body: This is a knife that may be aprecciated for someone without too many experience in camping because isn't made of the best material but is ok to begin to know and handle a sporting knife and it looks very nice.

title: Five Stars
body: AAA

title: fire starter will fall out
body: I received my knife and it looked like it was described.  The only thing was the fact that the fire starter fell out a few times.  this last time it fell out, i have yet been able to find it bummer? I did use the knife for other things and it was sharp to cut with.

title: very bad do not buy the flint in the first test ...
body: very bad do not buy the flint in the first test piece and also let out a knife is not sharp enough not cut. Is a fraud is BAD

title: Junk
body: Complete junk... Do not buy the knife. This knife is super dull the factory edge can't even cut paper. Did some sharpening by file and stone used it once or twice the edge worn out. (Does not hold a good edge) The lanyard fell apart with in 2 days. The magnesium stick is not bad but the knife is completely a piece of junk.

title: Great little knife.
body: Tjhis knife is exactly what it looks like: a small survival knife, great for any preparedness kit or camp bag.

title: Two Stars
body: Small knife

title: Five Stars
body: Good for price... But order a piece of kidex and make a better sheath

title: Sturdy little bugger
body: It's adequate for outdoor needs, can't beat the price at all!!! Sturdy little bugger!!!

title: great little flint fire starter
body: I just wanted the flint so the blade was a cool little bonus and it was all just $7! Good value

title: Great fire starter, decent knife.
body: The fire starter works well.  I have started campfires and lit up fire pits with it.  I like the knife.  A lot of people commented about it not being sharp enough, but I can do basic cutting while camping.  It won't cut thick rope quickly, so if you're looking for a really sharp knife, this isn't one.

title: Four Stars
body: Small and compact

title: Survival Knife
body: Got this for my boyfriend. He was very happy with it. Great price! Must have for any survival kit!

title: Its a nice knife
body: its pretty good

title: Great for the price.
body: It's a decently stout and sharp knife. The para-cord wrapping is done quite well. The fire starter works great with the back of the knife. It's in my "go bag" but I think I'm moving it to the car.

title: I ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND THIS KNIFE NOT TO MENTION IT COMES WITH A ...
body: THIS KNIFE FOR THE PRICE IS MORE THAN WORTH IT. I ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND THIS KNIFE NOT TO MENTION IT COMES WITH A FIRE STATER AND IS PACKAGED IN A WELL MADE STURDY BOX. IT'S A MUST HAVE AND DON'T THINK ABOUT IT JUST BUY IT AND YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED.

title: INCREDIBLE DEAL
body: I NEVER take the time to leave reviews so that should be an indicator on how pleased I am with this Knife. Is it a high end Gerber or Kershaw? No but then the price was not that either. VERY VERY substantial weight to it and solid as hell. The case is nice heavy duty and the magnesium alloy fire starter is a bonus. Great for a carry around every day knife for sure. The only thing I would say negative is the picture shows a black sheath and black para chord but I got green for both. Lol but I am happy enough with the knife and the price to not care.

title: A good Blade and firesteel too
body: With these two items you could survive,I keep it in my vehicle for emergencies,it is compact enough and can be carried everywhere with ease

title: I would if i could
body: DO NOT BUY FROM THESE PEOPLE!!!! IT IS A SHAM!!!! I BOUGHT ONE OF THESE KNIVES BUT NEVER GOT IT SO I CAN'T TELL YOU ABOUT THE KNIFE BUT I CAN TELL YOU ABOUT THE CUSTOMER SERVICE... WOW!!! IS ALL I HAVE TO SAY, MY WIFE CALLED THEM TO SEE WHY ITS BEEN THREE MONTHS TO GET KNIFE AND SHE WAS TOLD WE WERE S.O.L. THAT WE WERE NOT GOING TO GET KNIFE OR A REFUND!!!! DO NOT BUY FROM THESE PEOPLE IS WHAT I HAVE TO SAY!!!!!

title: Fantastic Value
body: Pros:Great PriceGood Fire-starterCons:Thing was so dull when it arrived that it had trouble cutting butter. Once we put some time into it with a sharpening tool though it was all good.Would I recommend it? Of course...But i would also recommend a good knife sharpening kit as well.

title: Great for the cost.. even better once you do a little.
body: First off, expect what you pay for. This is essentially a cheap knife when you get it, dull as a butter knife, and would probably cut your hand up if you really tried using it out of the box. However, after I sharpened the blade and re-550 corded it, this knife is now being added to my hiking, camping, and survival bags. With the fire starter, one of the best knives I have bought for under $10.

title: great all around knife
body: I bought this knife thinking it was going to be another cheap knife. But I was wrong it's a great tool to add to my hunting, fishinnd camping stuff thank you so much for the knife.

title: Five Stars
body: Great deal

title: sweet knife
body: love it super stoked... I will get lots od use out of this knife i event used the fire starter already

title: False
body: This product was a dissapointment... The blade was extremely dull needing to be completely sharpened and the "fire starter" doesn't work at all.I wouldn't reccommend this product for survival.

title: Perfect
body: Love this and the price is perfect for it.

title: cool knife
body: its cool, I got it for my buyout bag, so i can use it for a fire starter without dulling a knife i would use all the time

title: Great knife and fire starter...NOT a good sheath
body: Great knife and fire starter but after minimal use the sheath didn't hold up. After about 2 months of minimal use the tip of the knife pokes out of the sheath.

title: Ehhhh not so much
body: This knife is ok.  It's dull as can be and I couldn't seem to get it sharp even after using a sharpener for quite some time.  Never could get a single spark from the fire starter either.

title: good cheap camping knife
body: This is a nice little camping knife. It does need to be sharpened but for the price I'm fine with that. The flint strikers works good too. The sheath isn't the best but it works. The knife did poke through the bottom. All in all this is a great little camping knife and it would be tough to beat the price

title: Four Stars
body: Sitting ultra sharp in my emergency kit if I ever need it.

title: Not very sharp
body: Not very sharp at all for a knife.

title: For the cost (almost nothing) this is a great product. It was quite a bit smaller than ...
body: For the cost (almost nothing) this is a great product.  It was quite a bit smaller than I imagined, but it will be perfect for what I planned to use it for...storage for emergency situation.  Absolutely love this in every b.o.b. I have....

title: EXCELLENT junk knife
body: I got this as a "throw away" knife.However, It is really solid and SEEMS to hold a good edge, but haven't owned it long enough to test it much.Fire starter works as expected.  Sparks well.Mine came with a black pouch, which is well made from Web Gear type stuff, and the fire striker is adequate.Overall, I would pay twice as much for this and still be happy.Good product.

title: Solid little knife after it meets a good sharpener
body: This is a very solid little knife. As many have stated it needs a good patient sharpening, but after that it works well.  For the price I will gladly spend a little time and effort.  The fire starter is nice, works as well as the others I have purchased for the price of this whole kit.  The sheath is pretty flimsy but seems functional and has a belt loop.  I am not sure if I have the patience to build a better one.  I will definitely try more of these products since I have a decent sharpener, can't beat the prices!

title: Super fast shipping
body: Super fast shipping. I read a lot of reviews before ordering so I knew what I was getting. This knife is perfect for my needs. It is a hunk of steel that when you revive it, it wouldn't even cut butter and the handle is wrapped in something a bit better that yarn. However, with a bit of elbow grease I was able to put an edge in it, and I rewrapped the handle with paracord. I also replaced the yarn on the ferro rod with para cord. You will also need to take some med grit sand paper to the rod to get the finnish off l, and take it to a small spot on the back of the knife where you will strike the rod. This knife makes a good addition to my small "go bag". It's a cheap knife for those who can't afford expensive stuff just to store in a go bag.

title: Skinner
body: Nice little skinning knife for hunters! Holds edge pretty well! Striker is hard to work with but good to have! Perfect for price!!

title: everyday carry kind of knife
body: this is a great little knife for the price. the fire starter it comes with is AMAZING! i was able to get a decent fire going in a couple of minutes. the knife itself is really thick, so you can be sure it will last. the cheap 'paracord' wrap is decent, not great. the sheath is horrible. some of the threads were already coming undone, but you can fix that by putting a lighter up to it and melting the loose threads to the sheath.  all in all for the price, its a great lightweight little backup knife.

title: Great great buy
body: Great great knife. Sharp as hell! Fire starter wrks really really good. A must have for anybody camping or just preparing for anything

title: Five Stars
body: Best ever

title: Good experience.
body: Item was as described. Good experience.

title: Nice.
body: Got them for my kids belts as back-up knives and fire starter.  Nice size and durable sheath.  Very nice for the price.

title: Cheap but effective
body: Got this as a blunt work horse tool in my bag. Its cheaply made and the sheath sucks but for a throw away knife that could save your life, this is worth the cheap price.

title: Blade is not very sharp. I had a hard ...
body: Blade is not very  sharp.  I had a hard time cutting 550 cord.

title: Bad
body: The knife is dull and the flint brakes after a couple tries .I did not like it it was crappy

title: Good deal
body: Good knife for the price.Very hard to sharpen.The handle in paracord is ok for me

title: GREAT KNIFE!!!!
body: This knife is great. I love trying to get the best bang for my buck and this knife does just that. The sheath is good there seems to be some flexible plastic or something on the inside of the nylon sheath. The "paracord" is good though. It's some kind of threaded string but one paracord wrap and it's good. The steel is Chinese but it seems strong. Now I blacksmith and I heat treated the knife and it's even better. The blade is strong and holds an edge well. And the Flint is sturdy and throughs a nice shower of sparks. Overall the is an AMAZING knife for the money and I would recommend this to anyone looking for a first knife or a companion blade.

title: reliable knife
body: Overall it's a very good product. It's very sturdy, well made, well designed and very lightweight and compact. The blade is very sharp but the fire starter is not as good. I can always bring a match or a lighter though.

title: Good utility tool
body: Bought it to put in the back of the SUV as an emergency tool.  Just never know when you need a knife.Don't expect a big name knife, it's inexpensive, so if it gets lost not the end of the world.

title: Nice
body: Nice for the price.  Not to be used every day but handy to have in bug out bag or car glove box.  I also rewrapped the handle with real 550 para cord.

title: Knife/fire starter combo
body: This is a very good knife/fire starter for the money. This kit is now my go to kit for fire starting, a little bit of cotton ball and you've got fire, every time!

title: Surprised with the quality
body: This knife was really cheap so I wasnt expecting much but it is actually a very nice quality. Much heavier than I thought it would be attesting to its good quality. The paracord wrapped around the handle feels nice and gives a pretty good grip. Worth the buy.

title: Impressive for the price
body: Judging by what I paid for this knife I wasn't expecting much. When it came in the mail, much to my surprise, I was impressed.

title: Five Stars
body: Heavy in a good way

title: Great little inexpensive survival knife
body: Great little inexpensive survival knife. For the price its a great value and the fire starter is a nice plus. Small and light enough to carry easily in a back pack. You will need to sharpen this yourself. It says its stainless steel. We will see.

title: Five Stars
body: awesome knife for fishing ans hunting

title: I love this know
body: Despite having to sharpen it out of the box, I love this know. Perfect size for my hands and the fire starter is easy and effective.

title: good buy
body: Great knife for 7 bucks. The parachord is cheap and not real but the ferro rod works great and the knife is pretty sharp I'll test  out and see how it handles but so far I'm impressed

title: handle seems better fit for a child
body: make sure to read the size and then find a ruler and make sure u understand how small 7 inches total really is. handle seems better fit for a child. but they did tell me it was only 7 inches I just didn't realize how small it wud actually be...

title: Good
body: This knife needed a little sharpening but it is a little knife in a big package. If only it was made in the USA

title: best knife ever for the price!
body: It's good quality steel and will hold an edge. The case is serviceable and the fire starter works once you get past the coating.Impressive for price point

title: Great for Price!
body: I thought it was a great little back-up knife for the price...and free shipping! Plus, I got a nice firestarter with it. When I read the reviews, I couldn't help but be amazed at all the negative reviews about a cheap knife...it's not like you're ordering a Doug Ritter knife for pete's sake...I have to laugh over some of the reviews left by the arm-chair camping 'experts'... It arrived quicker than shipping estimate, was well packed with my other items. It did need to be sharpened, but performed minor tasks very well on our weekend camping trip. I was asked about it from fellow campers, who were surpriced by the low price I paid for it. I fully intend on buying more for Christmas gifts for the guys in my family.

title: great knife, but the fire starter is worthless
body: great knife, but the fire starter is worthless, I rigged up mine with a simple magnesium fire starter, instead. the knife is pretty sturdy and compact. Just don't expect the fire starter to work for long

title: Sharp knife but no Fire Starter
body: It wasn't until I received the request for review did I notice it was missing the Fire Starter. With that aside, the blade is very sharp. Recommend the product but ensure you receive the fire starter..

title: Cord is cheap
body: Dull knife. I replaced the cord with real paracord (550). You get what you pay for so I should have expected this. It was a nice gesture to give as a gift to my husband on Christmas.

title: Five Stars
body: Grest gift idea

title: great gift idea for co workers
body: purchased these a holiday gifts for friends and co workers.. never know when your gonna need a good survival knife when hunting, camping or working.

title: PRACTICO
body: ME HA SERVIDO CUANDO VOY AL CAMPO Y FACIL MANEJO Y MUY PRACTICO Y DE ELEGANCIA MUY BUENA LO RECOMIENDO

title: Can't beat the price
body: I was really surprised by the quality of the nice for the price ($3).  The fire starter works well and the knife is a nice one to have laying around or to use for small tasks (opening boxes, cutting rope).

title: Cheap, blunt and dangerous...
body: So where to start: I'm not a knife guy but I needed a compact knife to go into a survival kit and hopefully never see the light of day again! The fire starter flint came out of the plastic handle the first time I used it - glad I didn't have to rely on that. The edges on the top, where you are supposed to strike the flint, are slightly rounded at the edges where the blade has been stamped out of sheet metal. They should have a clear, 90 degree edge to get a good strike. The 'tough nylon' wrapped around the handle is cheap nylon chord, this made it feel very slippery to the touch and I wouldn't bet my life on not slipping while holding it and slicing my hand open on the blade, again, not good in a survival situation. The knife was completely dull and the blade unevenly peened, so sharpening it would be difficult. The annoying thing is, this knife could have been perfect. At a few bucks more, if there was proper Para-chord around the handle, a solid flint (plastic handles aren't really necessary if the flint is large enough), and the blade was sharp I would happily have it in my survival kit now.

title: looks cooler than it is
body: Not a terrible knife, limited utility. You're going to want to sharpen it. The point is sharp but the rest of the blade is hardly worthy of cutting anything. The flint works well though.

title: Good solid little knife
body: Good solid little knife. The fire starter capability is questionable though. I tried it out with a cotton ball and vaseline, and it failed. Perhaps I was using it wrong. I have a different magnesium starter that I don't have any trouble with though...

title: Wow!
body: Great quality for the price.VERY sharp. Feels good in your hand. Im hoping Ill get in a sticky situation soon just so i can use it.I keep one in my survival kit in my car.

title: Five Stars
body: Loved it!

title: ... i find the ferro rod to be of not great quality but for the price it a good deal
body: took two tries to give me a knife that was compleate  first one didnt have  ferro rod or cordage  and when i got the second one  i find the ferro rod to be of not great quality  but for the price it a good deal

title: Five Stars
body: haven't needed to use it but i feel better that its in my bug out bag in my trunk

title: Great value...
body: I've been using this little knife for a while now and I'm very happy with it. It is very useful and sturdy. Blade stays sharp enough thru normal use and easily sharpens. The fire starter is very good. Two recommendations... One, ditch the supplied cord and wrap the handle with real paracord... Two, cut out a small piece of plastic sheet and reinforce the nylon sheath inside to keep the blade point from sticking through the sheath.

title: Five Stars
body: Can't wait to merk some zombie with this thing.And then start a fire.

title: Good grub knife
body: Bought this as a utility knife for backpacking with the grand kids. Small enough to strap to my pack and tough enough for camp chores. The striker is a bonus, and works great!The sheath is a little rough. I lined mine with thin leather to keep from cutting the nylon. Blade came sharp, but improved with a little honing. Time will show how good the steel really is, but for whst I wanted, this will do just fine.

title: good for the money
body: thought for the money this was a nice addition to my go bag, wasnt a bad price, handy little knife

title: Great for gifts too, the fire starter is a fun conversation piece
body: Great knife! makes you want to forget about civilization and just live in the woods. Good weight in the handle, lots of metal, you don't feel that it's this cheap in any way, I have 5, because the blade and handle weight the same, this balance makes them great for throwing.

title: excellent
body: Satisfied with the ideal for camping and use in the field of very good quality meets indicated high quality material item.

title: hand size
body: cool little knife to have

title: amazing for the money
body: i only paid 7 bucks, and after i rewrapped the handle with some actual paracord instead of the cheap crap that was on there. sharpened up nice and the flint works well. it was a little shorter than i expected, the blade is about 3 inches and overall its about 7 inches, but it still feels good in hand.

title: Five Stars
body: Great knife to have in the field.

title: It was just as described on line.  Arrived as described.  Put to immediate use.
body: It was just as described on line.  Arrived as described.  Put to immediate use in my bug out bag kit

title: do not waste money
body: the quality, the metal, blade  the sheath everythingSUCKS!it is cool looking have to do a lot just to get a sharp edgeFire starter works

title: OK for backup
body: Works fine but blade is soft metal and doesn't hold a great edge long.  Works well as a spare or backup in a light backpack or bugout bag.

title: Get what you pay for
body: Overall quality of knife and fire starter seem good while the holster it came in is very cheap. Overall I would still rate it a good buy for the money spent and would purchase again

title: wow!! :)
body: very nice knife super cheap an quality is outstanding !!  i recommend this to anyone who is out doorsy an wants a great knife. the flint worked great as well. id definitely buy from these people again. :)))))

title: made a nice addition to my wife's car kit.
body: Good basic knife and fire starter.

title: Okay
body: When I purchased my Bear Grylls paracord knife, my son saw it and wanted something similar.  I didn't want to shell out that much money again for a knife for my son, who is younger and has a habit of losing them.  I picked this knife up pretty cheap and it's okay for what it is.  Definitely worth the few bucks I spent and it made my son happy.  He liked that it comes with a fire starter as I have been teaching him to make fires with it in our firepit.Pros:Very solid and has a good heft for its size.Comes with a fire starter that works pretty well.Cons:It came very dull and I had to sharpen it quite a bit.Again, it's worth the few bucks it costs.

title: Inexpensive and performs as expected
body: Small and durable. I bought this just as a starter survival kit for someone and it is holding up well thus far against the elements. No rust on it and the fire starter still provides a spark. Not a bad choice and inexpensive.

title: it's ok
body: Not as good as I had hoped but not quite junk either. The knife is full tang so that's good but the blade is not that sharp. I have not gotten around to re-edging it, perhaps that will help but it should be like razor from the factory and it's not.All in all its good for the money
